page.title: 09Rural Family Life
page.content: In Blighfieldthere is a family with 6 children. They live in a 1930 built council house. The father is unemployed so mother does cleaning and upholstery work or extra money. The 2 eldest daughters work locally. The children go to school in Uttoxeter and Abbots Bromley. The eldest girl is interested in farming and would like to take it up as a career. There is no central heating in the 3 bedroomed house, there is one solid fuel fire and parafin heaters. The house has electricity, mains water and a septic tank. they own the usual domestic appliances including cooker and fridge, also an electric mower for use in the large garden. They have a colour tv and a radi and modern music is popular. Everyone meets for the evening meal at which some convenience and frozen foods are used.
